newsitem.title: USA: Late Brent paper prices gain in U.S. aftermarket.
newsitem.headline: Late Brent paper prices gain in U.S. aftermarket.

text.p: North Sea Brent paper cargoes strengthened late in U.S. dealings Friday, with a Wall Street trader buying five full cargoes 12-17 cents over the July IPE settlement between $19.50-55 a barrel, traders said.
July IPE Brent settled at $19.38, eight cents lower from Thursday.
In the aftermarket, U.S. trader J.P. Morgan bought cargoes at $19.50, $19.52, $19.51 and two cargoes at $19.55 a barrel.
A pair of smaller Brent parcels were sold at $19.45 and $19.46 for July totalling 300 lots.
